channel.title: "New Shit" forum base! (PHP) (1.2)
channel.description:
This is a forum base which is currently in development. I have my own way of explaining and naming things, which, obviously, people cant handle :| But that's not my problem, if they are trying to act big over the internet, let them, they may have a higher rank on these forums, but i will finish this [b]then[/b] release it.
[u][b]These are the main aims:[/b][/u]
[ul][li]Cross-browser Compatible[/li] [li]Safe and Secure[/li] [li]I will try my best to keep the size of the entire base small, compared to others such as smf.[/li] [li]Fully customizable[/li] [li]Drop Down Login Panel (similar to r-s)[/li] [li]Who's online, Friends online, Private messaging, Image attatchments, File Uploading, Donating[/li] [li]Donator crown (Paypal IPN integration, customizable.)[/li] [li]Donator list on portal (front page)[/li] [li]Arcade section[/li] [li] Dragable items on portal (front page)[/li] [li]Everything can be changed from the browser, hence the reason for the "weird" :S layout. (erm...)[/li][/ul]
THE REASON IT HAD SUCH A WEIRD LAYOUT is to make it easier to update the site via online control panel.
[hr] Look at attachments for pictures. Feel free to request more.

item.title: "New Shit" forum base! (PHP) (1.2)
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

I have, and I am serious.
I have looked at and browsed through the SMF forum base before hand (for 3 weeks, and I have looked at phpbb too.)
I think i am ready to evaluate what people need and want from a forum base, while keeping it safe and secure, and easy to administer. It will be a huge challenge, but over time, I will be posting loads of more images.

BTW: The folder was called cache because I thought “What can I call a store for files?” Cache just came to mind first, I didn’t wikipedia it or anything to find out if it was supposed to be manually updated or not, i don’t really care, and it wont be manually updated when the project is finished.

Read full topic

item.title: "New Shit" forum base! (PHP) (1.2)
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

You know, if you’re serious about the project, you should take a look at some real website frameworks. (With a template system, for example)

Read full topic

item.title: "New Shit" forum base! (PHP) (1.2)
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Fuck this, im just gonna release it when its finished, it may make more sense then.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 28, 2009, 03:43:40 pm[/size][hr][quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:5, topic:275401”]no… just no. That is not a framework at all - gj for php-including external files.

Okay, i’ve decided to write my own (very) easy to edit forum software.

-Custom themes

Changing colours? No, that doesn’t count.

-Custom Settings

Uh, no.

-Great Infrastructure for any type of site.

Horrible file structure and a website back-end if that’s what you mean.

-Comes with a HTML color chart (to help with theme-design)!

Real men design their site in graphics editing software and use a color picker in the process of transforming it into XHTML and CSS.

-Added CSS themes, thanks to silabsoft

CSS THEMES ADDED

[quote]
-Removed all custom (.ini) settings, except for title.[/quote]
Why… .ini files?

-Great Infrastructure for any type of site.

Again, no.

-Code looks neater

No.

-Added JavaScript support (cache/js/)

<? //New Shit //Includes all javascripts include("js/New Script.js"); ?>

Fully fledged javascript support! Awesome!
Again, no.

-Added JavaScript support b[/b]

Do you know what content caches are even used for?

[quote]Example of a theme without using HTML HEX color codes:
-snip-[/quote]
No, you do not design nice websites by using 16 W3C-valid color names.

-Completley new look, very attractive.

Looks cleaner, yeah.

[quote]
-Updated the cache (Look in cache/README.rtf)[/quote]
You do not manually update caches…

I’d suggest you learn real web design, proper PHP scripting and how good website back-ends work before you attempt to help “beginners” with things such as these.[/quote]

I could not think of a name for the folder so I just named it “cache”, like the entire project “new shit”… as to the “colour code” comment, look here:
http://spartan.ac.brocku.ca/~tmulligan/colors.html
Thats what I used to get my “Word” colours, for the non obvious ones.
I added gradients, meaning you can change them to any colour, and style, but using the minimal amount of images.
It will get better, and I will post the next version when I have added SQL and renamed the folder, added navigational buttons etc.

Cheese_Police:

does this work with a 508 cache?

I tested it with a 525 cache, works great, dunno about the 508 though it doesnt support javaskript.

Read full topic

item.title: "New Shit" forum base! (PHP) (1.2)
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

does this work with a 508 cache?

item.title: "New Shit" forum base! (PHP) (1.2)
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

no… just no. That is not a framework at all - gj for php-including external files.

[quote=“tobias222, post:1, topic:275401”]Okay, i’ve decided to write my own (very) easy to edit forum software.

-Custom themes[/quote]
Changing colours? No, that doesn’t count.

-Custom Settings
Uh, no.
-Great Infrastructure for any type of site.
Horrible file structure and a website back-end if that's what you mean.
-Comes with a HTML color chart (to help with theme-design)!
Real men design their site in graphics editing software and use a color picker in the process of transforming it into XHTML and CSS.
-Added CSS themes, thanks to silabsoft
CSS THEMES ADDED
-Removed all custom (.ini) settings, except for title.
Why.. .ini files?
-Great Infrastructure for any type of site.
Again, no.
-Code looks neater
No.
-Added JavaScript support (cache/js/)
[code]<? //New Shit //Includes all javascripts include("js/New Script.js"); ?>[/code]

Fully fledged javascript support! Awesome!
Again, no.

-Added JavaScript support [u][b](cache/js/)[/b][/u]
Do you know what content caches are even used for?
Example of a theme without using HTML HEX color codes: -snip-
No, you do not design nice websites by using 16 W3C-valid color names.
-Completley new look, very attractive.
Looks cleaner, yeah.
-Updated the cache (Look in cache/README.rtf)
You do not manually update caches...

I’d suggest you learn real web design, proper PHP scripting and how good website back-ends work before you attempt to help “beginners” with things such as these.

Read full topic

item.title: "New Shit" forum base! (PHP) (1.2)
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

It is using css… but in a more interactive way (er?) lol :L.
It just means later I can make an online control panel easier and all it has to do is write to single files.
Idk, some people prefer this layout, i do.

BTW silab, on your webclient page you use “PRAGMA” in the headers as cache control, use the “CACHE-CONTROL” header tag aswell,
A freind of mine told me that would fix it 100%.[br][quote=“Cheese_Police, post:3, topic:275401”]http://punbb.org/

???[/quote]

Yes that is good but it has had much longer than 5 minutes of development.
I’ve only released it at this stage (before i add forum structure) to give people a chance
to develop it in their own way, I know its ugly at the minute, but i will work on that later.

NB: silab it is using CSS, only referring to PHP variables for the values.

Read full topic
